Articles.Content:
What is Modular Launch Sites?

This is a project to create different launch sites and random cosmetic objects to place around them. I will be using KerbTown, which allows you to place static objects in-game.

What do I have so far?

So far I have a one-third done launch site with a retractable launch tower. Before launch, you click on it and it rotates away from the rocket.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Also, a fuel storage tank!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

What do I have planned?

-A Baikonur-esque launch site with retractable launch tower.

-'Floating' launch site 'a la' SeaLaunch.

-Multi-missile silo.

-Different buildings.

-Fuel storage tanks.

-Radar dishes.

-SSWS tanks.

-A for-now-classified surprise

Please post feedback, ideas and comments!!!

Edited September 11, 2013 by POTKC

Now this looks like a cool idea, one thing I always disliked about the old stock tower was that it was static and could not be moved away. While I like the design of the stock pad in game now having pullback tower for manned launches would be cool.

Will be keeping an eye on this project, good luck!
Thank you!!!
Looks interesting, specially the bikanour and sea launch pads.
Yes! Please do this! I would love to have more launch sites but I am not that good at modeling.

I started developing first! But u posted first

Edited September 10, 2013 by rasheed
What pad is that?
Wait! Sketchup is compatible with this!? WHAAAT!? Where the kracken have I not seen this!? How did you export sketchup models to Unity?
There's a plugin IIRC.Edit: here is said plugin,http://www.playuptools.com/downloads/
or that sketchup comes with a .dae exporter. I simply imported the dae into unity
Well, rasheed, as we're doing the same thing, maybe we should join together?

Here's something for you to look at:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
A whole world of modeling has just been opened up for me..... Thanks!
What do you mean?

Well the only real 3D modeling program I can actually use/love/have lots of experience with is sketchup, so now with this knowledge, I can begin developing my own KSP add ons. Granted I understand modeling is only half of it, maybe less, especially when it involves plugin. Though we are getting off topic here. Hope the launchpad development goes well!

Did you miss this entire blogpost?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entry.php/747-The-Making-Of-New-KSC

You might want to take a look at it.
I just want to say, this has not died, I was in Venice without a computer and then the forums went down. I am now trying to learn Unity so some (untextured) models can be put into the game.
Looks nice! Can't wait!
Looks righteous. If you need help with it, or simply don't want to do it yourself, I'll gladly help with any modeling. I use Blender 3d, and not sketchup, however.
Any progress?
Not yet, Kowbell has helped me a lot with texturing of the fuel storage tank, but I haven't had time to put it through Unity. Hopefully tomorrow I will have something to show.

This would essentially force me to get KerbTown.

Nice work! I hope to see it released soon!

OK, something was glitching and I couldn't post for a day. I put the Fuel Storage Tank thought Unity, but when I put it into the game and pressed CTRL+K to open KerbTown, selected the model and pressed 'Create' it was sort of...invisible. I'm sure I did everything correctly, but...any ideas anyone?
